title: const fn has no result expression

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: A-const-fn
labels.description: Area: const fn foo(..) {..}. Pure functions which can be applied at compile time.

body:
``` rust
#![feature(const_fn)]
pub const fn test() {}
const X: () = test();
fn main() {}
```

ICEs with

```
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'const fn has no result expression', src/libcore/option.rs:700
stack backtrace:
   1:     0x7fc09db94d37 - sys::backtrace::tracing::imp::write::h8f11a6299019b37aN7u

  13:     0x7fc09e0ad934 - driver::phase_3_run_analysis_passes::_$u7b$$u7b$closure$u7d$$u7d$::closure.30847
```

The result expression should probably default to unit?
